The **Holy Spear of Light** is a rather useful artifact added in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM")[\[1\]](#cite_note-1). It is lawful, intelligent, has +5 to-hit and +10 damage to undead monsters: [L](/wiki/L "L"), [M](/wiki/M "M"), [W](/wiki/W "W"), [Z](/wiki/Z "Z"), [ghosts](/wiki/Ghost "Ghost") and [shades](/wiki/Shade "Shade"). The Spear's best use is its [invocation](/wiki/Invocation "Invocation"), which permanently lights a section of the dungeon, and also damages undead and demons caught in the light. High level undead such as Vecna have a chance of resisting. Being a [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear"), it also provides the +2 to-hit bonus against [kebabable](/wiki/Kebabable "Kebabable") monsters.

## Invocation

The spear's most noteworthy use is its invocation power:

- - *"The Holy Spear of Light shines brightly for an instant!"* (if not [blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind"))
  - *"The Holy Spear of Light grows warm for a second!"* (if blind)

The spear illuminates an area with a radius of 12 squares centered on the player. Note that this is larger than even a *blessed* [scroll of light](/wiki/Scroll_of_light "Scroll of light"), with a 9-square radius, making the spear very useful for lighting your way. Non-spellcasters will probably want to blank all the extra scrolls of light they have. Note that the spear is intelligent and will therefore blast you if you are not Lawful.

Within this radius, undead and [major demons](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon") take damage.

- - *"\<monster> burns in the radiance!"* (if you can see the monster)
  - *"You hear cry(ies) of intense pain!"* (if you can't)

This damage will never actually kill these monsters; A minimum of one remaining hit point is ensured. This will also not anger any peaceful undead it affects or decrease tameness of tame undead.

Note that if [you](/wiki/Player "Player") are playing as a [vampire](/wiki/Vampire_\(starting_race\) "Vampire (starting race)") or are [polymorphed](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into an undead or demon, your hit points will be divided by 100, with no minimum cutoff of one hit point. Death from this hit point loss will ***not*** revert you to your normal form, and will instead kill you outright. Also note that [high-level](/wiki/Difficulty "Difficulty") or [high-MR](/wiki/MR "MR") monsters may resist this damage altogether.

### Damage Done to Monsters

Hitpoints are divided by ![10 - \frac{distance^2}{10}](/images/math/f/e/6/fe61df90a981c4c8f126c12bb04e0679.png):

| Distance from player | Damage taken (% of monster HP) |
| -------------------- | ------------------------------ |
| 1                    | 89.90                          |
| 2                    | 89.58                          |
| 3                    | 89.01                          |
| 4                    | 88.10                          |
| 5                    | 86.67                          |
| 6                    | 84.38                          |
| 7                    | 80.39                          |
| 8                    | 72.22                          |
| 9                    | 47.37                          |
| 10+                  | 0.00                           |
